title: Megan McKenna's heartbreaking year as she lands place in X Factor: Celebrity live shows
text:

Megan McKenna broke down in tears as she was put through the the live shows of The X Factor : Celebrity.

And the stakes are even higher for her than many of her rival contestants.

The former TOWIE star has been trying to make it big on reality shows since she was a teenager auditioning for Britain's Got Talent in 2009.

But Megan, 27, needs a career break now more than ever after a tumultuous year in her private life.

In March, Megan faced a major and very sudden tragedy when her ex boyfriend Mike Thalassitis took his own life at the age of 26.

(Image: Instagram)

Mike was found hanged at a park near his home in North London after binging on cocaine and alcohol.

The Love Island star and Megan dated for seven months in 2018 before eventually deciding to call it a day after a string of rows.

After Mike's death was confirmed, many of his heartbroken co-stars and celebrity pals took to social media to pay tribute.

(Image: ITV)

(Image: Instagram)

Days later Megan eventually broke her silence days to admit she was in 'total shock.'

In an Instagram post, she said: "Sorry I haven’t been on social media but I’m in complete shock and trying to come to terms with this. I can’t believe I’m even writing this post. My thoughts and prayers are with Mike’s family."

She added: "Rest in peace Mike."

Megan had previously spoken of her hopes of starting a family with her ex. "I want three children and I want them all to look like Mike," she said.

She also opened up about how in love she'd been during an emotional chat on Celebs Go Dating.

(Image: Channel 4)

(Image: ITV)

After her loss, reality TV veteran Megan took a self-imposed break from the spotlight to deal privately with her grief.

A month on from Mike's death in March, Megan was spotted leaving the UK and flying out to Nashville to throw herself into her new music.

On her return, Megan jumped at the chance to get back to doing what she loves best - singing - when she was offered a spot on Simon Cowell's X Factor spin off.

But Megan says it taken a lot of personal growth to help get her confidence get back.

(Image: Instagram)

In an interview with The Sun ahead of her TV comeback, Megan revealed she's undergone therapy to help her deal the events of the last year which left her suffering panic attacks.

She said: "Obviously, this year I’ve had a few little panic attacks.

“I’ve had therapy, because as much as I have people around me to talk to, speaking to someone I don’t really know just helps me to deal with emotions and put things in the right p

(Image: PA Wire)

Viewers who watched Megan take to the stage on Saturday night may have also noticed a slight change in her appearance.

Judge Louis Walsh did, and awkwardly quizzed her about why she looks so different to the last time he saw her.

She told him she'd had her lip fillers removed from her top lip and cringed during her VT as she looked back on old scenes of her on TV.

Megan said she made the decision after overcoming her battle with body dismorphia.

(Image: megan_mckenna_/Instagram)

(Image: Beretta/Sims/REX)

Megan admitted: "I became obsessed with my lips. I’d take a photo of myself and if I didn’t think they looked big enough I’d make them bigger with an editing app.

"Honestly, I think I had body dysmorphia because when I look back at pictures of myself now I am horrified. I look like a duck. I don’t know how they didn’t bump into things! I can’t believe what I looked like," she cringed.

(Image: ITV)

But for now, Megan is back on form and hoping to impress the public after winning over judges Simon Cowell , Louis and Nicole Scherzinger with her singing ability.

Megan was placed in the tough 'unders' category along with Hayley Hasselhoff, Olivia Olson, Jonny Labey and Kevin McHale.

Everyone but David Hasselhoff's daughter Hayley made it to the live shows.

Though by some standards, Megan is a seasoned professional in the music industry compared to her rivals.

(Image: ITV)

After trying her hand at Country music, Megan bagged a number one on the iTunes chart in 2017 with her debut single High Heeled Shoes.

Speaking at the time, Megan revealed X Factor legend Louis had been secretly mentoring her.

She said: "Louis Walsh and I talk a lot about my music, and he's really happy with how it's going.

"Basically he actually was one of the people who said to me ages ago that I should go to Nashville and do a show."

We'll have to see how Megan fairs when The X Factor: Celebrity live shows kick off this Saturday on ITV at 8.20pm
description: Megan McKenna weeped as she was put through to the live shows of the ITV programme's celebrity version after a tumultuous year
